Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, fairly average expensive room”
Reviews.Author: H0lidayers2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the last leg of our honeymoon and were very excited upon entering the hotel-walking through a gorgeous courtyard into a lovely boutique reception. Unfortunately our room was not on par with the lovely entrance-dark red walls and a little claustrophobic. The shower was grubby with yellowing shower curtain & dirty stained bath. It was by far the least impressive room we had in 4 weeks in Europe & one of the most expensive (to be fair, acom in Paris is generally more expensive than anywhere else). Most of the staff were great, a couple of average touristic restaurant recommendations resulted in us choosing our own restaurants, one fairly unhelpful staff member seemed really put out by me enquiring how to get to the airport & how long we would need-left a bit of a sour taste -but the others were lovely. It's also unfortunate to read that another honeymoon couple had received special treatment when we had previous correspondence with the hotel that we would be traveling on our honeymoon (months in advance) and informed them we had been recommended to stay there by a family member who returns annually, only to feel like we got the worst room in the place and no special treatment (rightly or wrongly we had probably come to expect this seeing as every other hotel had). Nonetheless, the hotel is located in a great position and the restaurant up the road is fantastic (red & white table cloths), because of this it is a good place to rest your head. Oh, ps the honesty bar only serves basic spirits (smirnoff vodka etc) and that alone is €10 then add the mixer drink circa €5 - probably wise to drink elsewhere. had

Reviews.Title: “parisianne charm and culture”
Reviews.Author: hazel029
Reviews.Content: Just returned (last night) from an all too brief first visit to Paris.The Relais Christine was a fabulous introduction to all that Paris has to offer.The reception staff at the hotel were outstanding - knowledgeable,professional and most helpful.The location could not be bettered - close to the Odeon metro station and an abundance of quality cafes within easy walking distance.The hotel is an oasis of tranquility.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and enchanting experience!”
Reviews.Author: nanoStamford
Reviews.Content: Recommended by friends who'd honeymooned there, my husband and I were delighted by luxurious, romantic duplex at Relais Christine and surprised by the elegance of the spa and workout facilities. The fine breakfast service provided a perfect beginning to each day's adventures. Our duplex room, with its rich jewel tones and updated private bath delighted our senses and offered all the amenties and conveniences associated with the best hotels. Every member of the staff was courteous and helpful, and we walked to shops, museums and restaurants from the superb location in Saint Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mshayda
Reviews.Content: Relais Christine is by far one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon and couldn't have been happier. They had a nice bottle of champagne and chocolate waiting in the room on our arrival. The hotel was amazing, spa area was fantastic. Very small, quaint and private. I couldn't recommend this hotel enough. We stayed in November so the prices were a bit more reasonable, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Peter02557
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. It is elegant without being in any way pretentious. Staff and service are perfect. The rooms are nice sized and the location is fabulous. On very short street and easy walk to Notre Dame, Lourve, Latin Quarter, etc. In the 6th on edge of Latin Quarter and within 10 minute walk to 7th. There are 3 great restaurants right on Rue Christine. This was our first trip to Paris and my wife and I agreed we will definitely stay at Relais Christine when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hanssonic
Reviews.Content: Great location. The closeness to everything. Free internet that works well (all hotels should have that!) Kind staff. Nice breakfast. I can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, easy to get around”
Reviews.Author: CamDea
Reviews.Content: Relais Christine is near the St Germain area and easy to get around. Close to the latin district for restaurants, offering many options for meals. The hotel is a short walk from the Seine and St Michel's railway stations. The room is clean and staff friendly. You do need to climb a few stairs to get to the room, there is a small lift available, if needed. The hotel has a nice lounge area, which has an honour bar and fireplace which is comfortable and relaxing - no tea and coffee facilities in the lounge or rooms, but you can order as needed. The breakfast room is in the basement (it looks like an old kitchen) adding to the charm of the location. It is a bit dark for breakfast, but offers a reasonable continental breakfast to start the day. We have been to Paris a number of time and this hotel was recommended by our travel agent, we will most certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: fiona e
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous place for a first visit to Paris. The Relais Christine is on a quiet back street a short distance from Pont Neuf and is housed in a former convent. The staff on receptoin were very friendly and helpful and sorted all our taxi and restaurant bookings with charm and minimal fuss. The buffet breakfast was delicious and kept us going well into the afternoon when we stopped for chocolat chaud at various pitstops! The convenience of the location together with the service and style of the Relais Christine made this stay an unbeatable experience. A very classy place.Thoroughly recommend this hotel and can't wait to return. Thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning historic hotel in the heart of le Marais”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaBlakey
Reviews.Content: Great location, gorgeous lounge, very friendly staff and a lovely hotel. Only complaint is that the rooms are a touch too dark.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, service, & elan”
Reviews.Author: Limahuli
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is now our new favorite in Paris. Our suite had French doors opening onto a garden. The room service food was delicious and simple. The staff was gracious, helpful and uniformly wonderful. We gathered pastries from an abundance of world class patisseries on the Left Bank. Went back to Relais Christine where we conducted a tasting with other like-minded guests in the Lounge area. Sublime.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in the City of Lights”
Reviews.Author: BeachDreamer
Reviews.Content: You cross over the bridge to the Left Bank, pass Notre Dame de Paris and begin turning down narrow streets that look like a movie set. The Christine street was opened in 1607 and the Relais Christine was built from a 16th century plan, standing between an inner courtyard and a garden. Your taxi stops in front of the beautiful 5 story courtyard - perfection. A bellman comes out to welcome you and take your luggage. And as you approach entrance, you almost hear Edith Piaf singing La Vie en Rose - I half expected to see Woody Allen in the Lobby. The staff is gracious and more than helpful. The building has been exceptionally refurbished - modern yet warm - muted colors, upholstered walls, exceptional portraits and art on the walls. A fire and "Honesty bar" beckoned from the Salon. We had a Garden Suite - classic, tailored, elegant, and large - A living room with couch bed and desk and bedroom - two bathrooms - and the toiletries - Ooh la la! the best ever. We had French doors in the living room to the courtyard and French doors to the garden from the bedroom. It is a small hotel and you feel like an honored guest in a great friend's home. The WIFI and car park is complimentary (what a concept) and it has all the amenities of a small five star hotel plus a full gym and spa with masseuse. You can rent a car or borrow a bike. Wonderful restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Relais Christine will make you fall in love with Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Relais Christine... Heaven!!”
Reviews.Author: Trish P
Reviews.Content: After a gap of 32 years I wondered if my wonderful memories of the Relais Christine were real or just imaginings of an idyllic Parisian adventure. I only had to walk through the gate to realise I had been right all along. The area is fantastic, the restaurants next door and across the tiny cobbled street are fabulous and the Relais Christine is heaven. My husband and I loved all over again the warmth and amazing customer service. You feel so special and welcome. The atmosphere is old-world, with just the right mix of relaxation, charm and glamour that is the 6th. We danced in the street on New Year's Eve. Our sincere thanks to Jean Luc Chomat and his wonderful staff for an amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca D
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an all too short stay at the Relais Christine, and would echo all the other complimentary comments about the prettiness of the hotel, its perfect location, etc. Our room was clean and comfortable, and we certainly didn't find it small by Paris standards. What impressed us most, however, was the friendliness and professionalism of the staff, who were unfailingly smiling and helpful! We both look forward to returning to the Christine

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NZ24
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Relais Christine over NYE for 4 nights. Really pretty hotel, well managed, run very well. The area is really great, busy and bustling, sometimes a bit touristy, but close to a lot of great restaurants and museums. Rooms are small, even for Paris, and very expensive, but comfortable and clean. The bathroom was surprisingly large for such a small room. The jacuzzi, sauna and gym were great as well. Breakfast was simple, nothing special, and we only ate there once. The greatest part of the hotel was the front desk staff who managed to get us front row tickets to a concert in Saint-Michel, book great restaurants with no notice, etc... For such a busy time of year, they were impressive

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JayPee2703
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 2 nights break in December. It's really great place to stay - location is just perfect, it's small boutique hotel, historical place in great shape and charm. And what's the best here is the staff. The service is just perfect and all staff members we met were smiling, welcoming and nothing was a trouble. I can only highly recommend this place if you are looking for something special and want to raise your Paris experience!

Reviews.Title: “Silence, Intimacy and excellent services in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: mnsuba
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 10 days in early December in this lovely, beautiful, quiet , reserved and very well managed hotel just a few blocks from the best of Paris. It was not my first time there and I can positively afirm that they are getting better and better. You cannot find a more friendly and helpful staff anywhere in Paris. I loved my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Location is ideal”
Reviews.Author: jim_ontheroad2011
Reviews.Content: Location, location... a helpful staff, excellent breakfast and did I mention the location. Our room was a garden suite which was pleasant yet had an odd layout as the toilet was through the parlor area. The common area was comfortable and the out door courtyard was appealing. Will stay again when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The Paris everyone should experience”
Reviews.Author: KJM-NYC
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of the hotel when walking through the beautifully lined courtyard with the lights and the scent of the fresh Christmas trees was an absolute delight. When viewing the pictures of the hotel, one looks at the quaint courtyard which is so quintessentially Paris. It lives up to every expectation from the little street you enter through and through the gates of the hotel. When we entered the hotel we were greeted by very friendly and accommodating staff at the concierge. We were very jet lagged and they immediately brought up some espresso for us to be energized to be on our way exploring the city. They were courteous, charming and professional and always willing to help. One example of their exceptional service was when my husband and I were walking through a part of Paris we did not know, we emailed them looking for a restaurant, they emailed us back right away with recommendations. The honesty bar, a bar that is in their sitting room that you can take out any beverage you want from juice to champagne to cognac and put your room number down to be accountable, is something we have never encountered before and it is a fabulous idea. The breakfast room downstairs is wonderfully old world with stones of the building that are exposed on the walls and the breakfast buffet was delightful. I was really impressed with the hotel, staff and the service that they provided and I am delighted to give an excellent review of the most charming hotel I have stayed in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, lovely hotel. Perfect location, perfect trip.”
Reviews.Author: BayHead
Reviews.Content: I gave my 15 year old daughter a trip to Paris as a gift in July and we stayed at the Relais-Christine. I lived in Paris years ago and I knew that I wanted to stay in a central location. We researched hotels meticulously. This research was part of the fun. We kept coming back to the Relais-Christine as our choice because of the location, size, and unique look. We were not disappointed. We loved our room (#57) and the location was wonderful. The hotel is in the 6th arrondisement and very close to the Seine, Notre Dame and Place St. Michel. Although located in the bustling 6th arrondisement, the hotel is located on a small side street and it is very private and quiet. The front desk staff was reserved yet quite enthusiastic when asked for suggestions. We loved the restaurant that they suggested just across the street. We also loved soaking our sore feet in the hot tub in the downstairs gym at the end of the day. This is an overlooked but "well worth it" part of the hotel. There is not an extra fee and the gym and hot tub are lovely. This part of the hotel also has that former abbey feel with the vaulted ceiling and quiet stillness. What a wonderful way to cap off a day of nonstop walking and sightseeing. We also enjoyed meeting other travelers while we enjoyed a drink in the lounge area after a busy day. A special thank you to Director Jean Luc Chomat for his help in researching a cooking school. My daughter was set on taking a cooking class while in Paris. We researched and found 'La Cuisine Paris" online but we were unsure about whether it was legitimate. Monsieur Chomat called the cooking school and made sure it was legitimate. Our subsequent class at La Cuisine Paris turned out to be one of our best experiences during our trip (see my review on La Cuisine Paris). We loved our room - we had a duplex and found it quiet and comfortable. It was one of the larger rooms. Overall - a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very special, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: MCE63
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous returning to the Relais Christine for a second time because I thought it couldn't possibly live up to the great memories I had. But it did - and more! Charming and quirky, from the lovely and comfortable surroundings, to the gracious and helpful staff, it's a real pleasure to be there. Its location is perfect, set back from a quiet street in the heart of St Germain so plenty of entertainment and restaurants close by if you can bear to drag yourself away.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous haven in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Alex168
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Relais Christine for 3 nights to celebrate our wedding anniversary and my birthday. We would return in a heartbeat - the service was gracious and friendly and all the staff made us feel very welcome (even though we were very casually dressed) - they were always warm and obliging. The service was extremely professional yet personal and we felt so very much at home. Our room was charming, high ceilings with wooden beams, big bay windows overlooking the courtyard. The staff and management have ensured all the extras are provided - turn down service, L'Occitane products, chocolates by your bedside, weather report - and they also provide you with theater/museum tickets which saves you the hassle of queuing. Breakfast is served in a wonderful setting with a historic fireplace - all very cosy and relaxing. The food was very good - fresh fruit, excellent pastries, hams, scrambled eggs - all high quality and delicious. An added touch - the management provided us a bottle of champagne to wish me happy birthday - which was wonderful. They also upgraded us from a superior to a deluxe room and also included breakfast in the rate due to a mix up on our side. All in all - our stay was everything and more we could have hoped for and I have already been recommending this lovely hotel to my friends and family! My husband and I are planning to return very soon. Thank you again to all the management and staff at Relais Christine for making our trip truly memorable. Merci beaucop. C'est tres excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint.”
Reviews.Author: bonedoc74
Reviews.Content: Very expensive but quaint botique hotel in nice section of Paris. Convenient to all Paris attractions. Wonderful courtyard. Rooms are small by American standards. Elevators are ridiculously small but it is an old Abbey. Staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ollie1952
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at Relais Chrsitine and it was all good. It's in a perfect location in St Germain with loads of nice bistro restaurants nearby (we went to Chez Ferdinad twice in two days - lunch and dinner and both times the food and service was excellent). Its also a very central location for sightseeing and shopping. We had a superior room which was a reasonable size and nicely furnished, modern bathroom an comfortable bed. Rather a small television but that didnt matter to us. The hotel itself is comfortable and well decorated (mix of modern and antiques) but it doesnt have a restaurant although there is a breakfast room in the cellar which is well done but there is a restaurant (Le Christine) right next door so it was never an issue. Service is friendly and efficient.Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection on rue Christine”
Reviews.Author: PacificHeights7
Reviews.Content: Relais Christine is my top choice when staying in Paris. I recently spent ten nights at this wonderful small hotel. The staff is professional, courteous, and efficient. My room (room 60) had a large window facing rue Christine. It was quiet even though it faced the street. The room size was large by Paris standards with a sofa, book shelves, and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was also large and luxurious. Great staff, great small boutique hotel, honors bar, and my favorite neighborhood in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and Grace”
Reviews.Author: grapeguy33324
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth stay at Relais Christine and I don't even think about staying elsewhere in Paris. The hotel is relatively small, in a great location and the serivce is top notch, particulary given that it is not among the most expensive hotels in Paris. The rooms are adequate in size with very nice bathrooms and a good work out facility for a small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A birthday break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: dwainlondon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Relais Christine one several occasions and chose to stay again on this recent trip. This is a charming, unique and friendly boutique hotel in one of the most desirable neighbourhoods of Paris. The room was large and overlooked the main street which was quiet and comfortable. The bathroom was large and came with top of the line products, lots of clean white towels and lots of strong hot water. The staff were more than accommodating, they were welcoming and friendly and made a point to recognise me when I came and went from the hotel. The breakfast was included in my room rate, coffee was excellent and plentiful which was welcome early in the morning when I arrived in the breakfast room. Even better when I had coffee served in the main lounge which included an honour bar in the evenings. I hope that my next trip is a welcoming and enjoyable. I will definitely stay at the Relais Christine again when I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: KaitlinS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night and liked the location in St Germain on a quiet street. The courtyard entrance is charming although once inside we found it cramped and stuffy. Our room was a two level loft set up with the bedroom in the loft and the sitting area and bathroom below which was very cramped and uncomfortable. We asked the very reserved staff for a dinner recommendation which was less than average.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bellagamba22
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a spur of the moment weekend trip to Paris, where we stayed at the Relais Christine for two nights. I agonized over choosing a hotel, given the short notice and the fact that we are very picky :), but we could not have been happier with our stay. I used to live in Paris and this is just a fabulous location. Our room was so lovely and comfortable, and the hotel itself is absolutely exquisite. A word about the staff - they could not have been more accommodating. It had been five years since I spoke a word of French, and they were very patient with me. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: aussietraveller47
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night on 2 separate occasions in September/Oct 2011, and really enjoyed it. The staff are very friendly and helpful, we really enjoyed the honesty bar where you help yourselves (the champagne on the first occasion was Billecart which was soooooooooo delicious!), and it's in a great position in the 6th, very close to the Ile de la Cite. Very quiet little street, and our room overlooked their garden each time. There is a charming entry courtyard. The rooms are a little small, but beds very comfortable, wifi free as is usual these days. We went down into the historic basement dining room to have their (rather expensive) breakfast, but left when we found it full of people but totally silent. Went instead to the Cafe de Paris nearby, 12.50 euro and wonderful cooked breakfast. Thoroughly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great End to Vacation Trip”
Reviews.Author: cmc75
Reviews.Content: This is a super hotel, very well placed to walk to many locations. Among those nearest are the Musee D'Orsay, Notre Dame, and the Sorbonne. The area abounds with excellent restaurants and the staff are extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service, Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jody L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed this hidden gem. It is right in the center of great neighborhoods in Paris but is removed enough from the fray to feel private and cozy. You can leave the hotel and be in the center of St. Germain des Pres or Odeon or at the Louvre in minutes, not to mention lots of great bakeries nearby. The rooms are not large but the decor felt just right for the character of Paris. We would go back. The breakfast, however, provided no service and was $30 Euros a person ($45). I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific little gem in the great neighborhood of St Germain!”
Reviews.Author: Dmp212
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great trip to Paris and have to equate alot of that to Relais Christine. They have a great location, right in St Germain, on a quaint little street. Walking distance to the St Michel metro line and Odeon. The staff were so friendly and helpful, the double room was terrific and the air conditioning in the rooms were terrific! The concierge helped us with our dinner reservations every night and got us into some of the most sought after venues in Paris. Great job to the staff and hotel of Relais Christine. I wouldn't stay anywhere else if we had to do it over again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Astilbe_Arendsii
Reviews.Content: We were stranded by Hurricane Irene, had to switch hotels and wound up at Relais Christine - what serendipity (we liked Christine much better than where we had been). Excellent reception staff got us checked in early, flustered as we were by flight cancellation. Main lobby area has well-stocked honor bar which was very pleasant. Location is terrific for dining around St Germain and also for an easy walk to main Paris attractions. Room was small but that's Paris. Small but nice spa area downstairs. Not an inexpensive Relais but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “problems”
Reviews.Author: firefly30
Reviews.Content: We arrived for two nights at the christine booked through SLH hotels.We were greeted at the reception be elizabeth ... who was wonderful & charming .Infact all the staff were very good .My problem was with the room No 70 top floor front of hotel .. it was very very dark.& very quiet during the day .. in the wee small hours it was very noisy from revellers outside & just when that had finished .. the bin men arrived & did two circuits each morning. I have to say i complained & i was treated courtiously & looked after .I would definately return ... if welcome of course... but would request a first floor room in the courtyard with their lovely french windows

Reviews.Title: “Best accomodation in central Paris - your search is over!!”
Reviews.Author: T-tyme
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and 3 kids) stayed at this remarkable hotel and they met or exceeding every expectation. Not only is it an architecturally splendid building, but in arguably the single best location in central Paris - just across from the Louvre and Notre Dame and right in the middle of a stimulating pedestrian area with shops, restaurants, etc., yet also tucked away on a quiet side street. Meanwhile, the spa is open 24 hours (this is not a typo) which means you will actually get to enjoy it and still do things during the day, the "honesty" bar concept is appealing and has a great atmosphere (and you pour your own drinks), parking is free underneath the hotel (unheard of in Paris), breakfast was fantastic (and in a 16th century chamber), and the staff could NOT have been more accommodating. They were polite, concerned, helpful, and genuinely interested in assuring you have a successful and pleasant holiday. We had room no. 1 and 2 adjoining, which was great as it opened up to the courtyard. This was perfect for our mature black lab, who was so welcomed by the staff (our dog is very well-behaved / obedient and travels everywhere with us - I would not recommend bringing a "barker"). Our family LOVED it and certainly we are familiar with Paris and I am convinced you cannot match this hotel for all things considered above anywhere in Paris. We always stayed in different hotels but not anymore. From now on we look no further. Relais Christine, your hard work has paid off, you deserved every word of this review!! Thanks again and we see you soon (hopefully).

Reviews.Title: “Would be good if it all worked”
Reviews.Author: m0ntesansavin0
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the centre of it all but it is very quiet and set away from the road. The rooms are small but the bed is comfortable. We had a deluxe room. Now the bad things: there is nowhere comfortable to sit; the sofa in the room is very uncomfortable. there is a small desk and a chair pushed next to the bed. The small TV is opposite the bed. The TV system worked when we arrived but stopped working on Friday and still had not been fixed by Sunday midday. It was a problem throughout the hotel. The air-conditioning was very noisy and it would have been difficult to sleep with it on. In room 30 it was possible to hear people talking next door. Breakfast was ok but at €30 a head on top of the €400 a night for the room barely adequate; who wants to eat scrambled eggs cooked 3 hours ago? The good side was that the staff were very helpful and the hotel is away from the street noise.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: CLIFFORDH8
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Paris great location it is like staying in your very own mansion the most friendly staff they take care of you like you are family, the breakfast is truly great. there is no restaurant in the hotel but there are and abundance of great ones all over the St Germain area.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, peaceful and wonderful help”
Reviews.Author: MiketheTiger08
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our weekend at the Relais Christine. Arrived a bit before the 2 pm check in and had no problem going straight to the upgraded room. Room was nice and comfortable and quite large. The staff was very friendly, knowledgable and helpful. Gave very good directions and recommendations on everything about Paris. Breakfast was nice, had it in the room our last day. Service was always spot on. Location is great, it was nice and quiet in the evenings. Just wished that there was a nice place for morning coffee or evening wine outside, the lobby was nice, but it was such good weather it would have been great to be able to sit in the garden and enjoy. Overall a great place to stay and will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “So happy we chose Relais Christine”
Reviews.Author: Kerrysdale
Reviews.Content: So many hotels to choose from in Paris; took a chance with Relais Christine and was not disappointed. Pros: located in lively St. Germain des Pres, within walking distance of major sights, beautiful courtyard entrance off the quite Rue Christine, roomy and charming loft suite, classy public spaces, yummy breakfast, first class staff, excellent restaurants 2 doors away in both directions. Cons: None.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little secret in St. Germain”
Reviews.Author: Exploringeurope
Reviews.Content: This little jewel is charming and very well kept. it is tucked hidden in a little street in St. Germain but very close to Notre Dame, D' Orsay, and Louvre. It is a great place to stay if you want to feel bohemian and explore the neighborhood. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Ray9_945
Reviews.Content: Very attentive and pleasant staff. Hotel was very clean and our room was very well appointed. Location is ideal since it's in the very heart of St. Germain de Pres but not on a busy street. Concierge was very knowledgeable and was most willing to please.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DustyRenee
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for three nights and just loved it. We had business and pleasure and it was perfect. The hotel staff was so kind and upgraded us to a wonderful suite. The staff is lovely. The hotel is super romantic and in the best location in Paris. Highly recommend this place and pretty reasonably priced for what you get out of it.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Perfect”
Reviews.Author: danixnyc
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation through SLH and got a very good rate. The had a small and very well appointed room, everything was super clean, lots of electric outlets. The bathroom was great, the provided toiletries from L'Occitane were yummy. From arrival to the nightly turn-down service there always a little treat, nice chocolates, wine, a fruit basket. The breakfast is excellent, the croissants delicious. They have a spa that looks very nice but I have not used. The concierge is excellent, got us all the reservations we needed and gave good suggestions. They have bikes that can be used around the city which is convenient and fun. The location is perfect on a one block street, in St Germain but not in the middle of the mess and masses and just a couple of blocks from the river. The front desk people are helpful and always polite. We are going back this September and the funny thing is that we chose to go back here instead of someplace bigger and fancier, something to be said about intimate good service.Looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: aris101
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently visited Paris and were fortunate to have made reservations at Relais Christine. The staff was extremely friendly and all of our requests - from dinner reservations to extra wine glasses in the room - were handled promptly. The hotel was immaculate. An added benefit is that the hotel is minutes from Notre Dame and the Louvre, yet it is located on a very quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great intimate setting”
Reviews.Author: tweyn
Reviews.Content: This is truly one of the great small luxury hotels. Don't over estimate the value of the included breakfast, not just continental, but full. Also the convenience of location to everything is a huge cost and time saver. Walking distance to Notre Dame, D'Orsey, Lourve, Saint Chappelle, etc. Other direction head to Luxembourg Gardens. Great places to eat too. Buci Street has life and food. Great Staff, quiet setting you'd never know the center city is 200 yards away.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but charming in St Germaine du prez.”
Reviews.Author: SDPearson
Reviews.Content: We had a suite for a family of four. It was up high with tiny windows and very poor lighting. Don't plan to read here. The breakfast and lobby are delightful ad the staff super helpful. And the setting couldn't be more charming. But $1000 for the night was jaw dropping.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MPD8475
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from 9 nights in Paris staying at Relais Christine, originally we'd booked an apartment however this fell through at the last minute and we booked the Relais Christine a few days before leaving. I cannot speak highly enough of this hotel, the location is perfect, the staff genuinely fantastic, and our room (room 60, a superior room I believe) was brilliant - we especially enjoyed the Georges Brassens CD that was in the room to listen to. While the cost of the hotel ended up being a significant increase over the apartment we were orginally planning to stay in, I can most definately say that the quality of the hotel will be remembered long after the price is forgotten!! Now, I must go buy that Georges Brassens CD from iTunes :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: shotrock
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Relais Christine. The hotel is located in a great area,just several blocks from the Seine, and a short walk to St.Germain. The area is filled with many great affordable restaurants, bars and cafes. The hotel itself is very nice, very clean, with wonderful attentive staff. We had a very good sized deluxe room located with direct access to the courtyard. The bathroom, and shower were excellent, and everything was very clean. The gym and breakfast area in the caves were very nice and enjoyable to go to.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need upgrading”
Reviews.Author: HoracioLima_Peru
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Relais Christine in the last 25 years. I am sad to say that I found the standard of the rooms has gone down, or at least not kept up with what is expected from a 4-star hotel in that price range. Our room was small, smelt of paint, was noisy (could hear neighbour's TV and lift every time it was used), and had an old fashioned TV. However, staff were attentive and polite, and the entrance and communal areas have retained the charm of our past stays.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay at a perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kristianhk
Reviews.Content: We got married in Paris in March, and stayed at Relais Christine - a wonderful and cozy little hotel, with the little details you will love. The staff was very kind and helpful in every way, surprising us with champagne on our wedding day, and by being very welcoming and helpful during our entire stay. The room was cozy, with a view out to a quiet little green backyard (where you can get a little garden as part of your room, if you rent one of those rooms). The hotel itself is also localized in a quiet side street, with walking distance to everything you need - in a very nice neighborhood. Roomservice was a treat, with new towels, bathrobes, little french soaps, etc. as often as twice a day, accompanied by a couple of amazing chocolates and the weather forecast for the next day. We didn't try the breakfast at the hotel, as we wanted to explore Paris for that. They also offered food on the room-service menu, but we didn't try that either. Free Wifi - ask at the front desk for a password that will last your entire stay. Minibar. Very comfortable bed. Very nice and modern bathroom with everything you will need. Safe with pin-code for your valuables. CD-player in the room, with a cd of a french singer included - perfect to get into Paris-mode :) We would love to come here for our anniversary some time! :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: nyc1967
Reviews.Content: This was a truly wonderful boutique hotel. The location could not have been better. You are in the middle of things and can walk practically everywhere and yet are on a quiet and charming little street. The staff was fantastic. We relied on the front desk for lots of suggestions and they were always helpful and cheerful and upbeat. We arrived at 8:45 am and they were able to get us into our room by 9am. There was a free computer in the lobby and a cozy lounge area. The room was spacious and clean with very comfortable beds and a modern bathroom. I would absolutely stay here again. I only have two minor negatives: 1. The toilet was in a separate room from the rest of the bathroom and that room did not contain a sink. 2. The breakfast was adequate but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, hidden away down a little side street is the perfect haven from the busy Parisian attractions.”
Reviews.Author: MrsMcSweeney
Reviews.Content: With a small child left at home we could only afford the luxury of two nights and three days honeymoon away from home. We splashed out a little and after much research decided to take a trip to the Relais Christine. My husband and myself were well aware that often four star French hotels are not always to the same standard as four star hotels in other countries but in spite of this we decided to pay a little more in order to have the perfect location (even if this meant sacrificing the standard of the hotel). It turned out to be a brilliant choice for many reasons. Location: The hotel is right in the midst of the action in Paris, literally a stones throw from the Seine River. Directly across from the river is the Louvre and walk a little further down from there and you fall upon the stunning Notre Damne Cathedral. With two close Metro stations next to the hotel it is so convenient for touring all of the Parisian hot spots. The hotel itself is located towards the back of a quiet little side street away from the bustle of the surrounding Bistros, bars and cafes. The cast iron gate way reveals a building full of old age charm with picturesque flower boxes on every window and ivy climbing the traditional stone walls. Rooms, Sleep Quality, Cleanliness and Service: We had paid for a left bank honeymoon package and so this came with a deluxe room, spa access (which we didn't use as were too busy- I believe this was only a sauna, jacuzzi and fitness suite though, massages etc come at extra cost), Buffet Breakfast both mornings, bottle of champagne and open top car tour. I really feel like this package turned out to be good value for the money we paid with all of the extras that were part of the package. The room was nowhere near as small as I expected (Ive stayed in France before and the rooms are often tiny!), nice decor, lovely bathroom with duel sinks and large mirror, plenty of storage, hifi, mini-bar, t.v, air-con, and large french windows that opened looking out onto the pretty courtyard below. We couldn't fault the cleanliness, the beds were so comfy, thick dark curtains, cooled room from the air-con and the hotel so peaceful that you could not do any other than have a good nights sleep! The buffet breakfast was wide and varied. You sometimes have to wait for your table to be reset before you dive in but there is no hurry, the staff are happy to help if you need something and so polite. The waiters offer you tea or coffee and bring you a basket of delicious fresh rolls, pastries, jams and butter. You can also help yourself to sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs, toast, fresh fruit, yoghurt, cereals, ham, cheese and fresh juices. All very fresh and tasty. The service was impecable from all members of staff. We were left chocolates and a note about the predicted weather the next day afte the turn down service on an evening, were served the most delicious champagne in the honesty bar with a note congratulating us on our honeymoon and the staff were more than happy to order a taxi for us when we needed one. They spoke fluent English and were so respectful and helpful. As for the open topped car tour, that was brilliant! One of my favourite moments of the trip (we did have glorious weather for it though!) our guide was lovely and spoke English better than we did! He was so nice and friendly and gave us the choice of a classic or unexpected tour of the city, we opted for the unexpected as we had already seen most of the most famous sites and we weren't disappointed! It was so interesting to see and hear about the city's oldest houses and churches, a secret garden, beautiful statues and buildings and many other places of interest. All in all the Relais Christine and the Honeymoon package more than met our expectations, beautiful hotel, great services and a fantastic stay. It was a little more expensive than we could normally afford but that is the price you pay for such an optimum location. Up-market without being snooty! It wasn't the Ritz but it had such a charm, picturesque, truely Parisian feel to it that Id rather stay there any day! Id love to go again :)

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistence in the quality of service delivery”
Reviews.Author: Giuseppe2255
Reviews.Content: 什麼，要中文啊？那我把下面總結一下。服務品質不是很一致，但大致上還有基本水準。房間的裝修風格優秀，但是細節可以加強。特別要表揚總領班還有夜班帥哥。 我覺得細節可加強，以我付的價錢是沒有超值的演出的。 Pros: 1. The collaboration with SLH.com 2. Refined amenities of the mix-match style 3. Tub equipped in every single room. 4. Superbe location 5. The duplex suite I am now staying at is quite large from an European standard 6. A handsome close d'or gent who is professional and willingly helpful, though he doesn't speak English much 7. The nightshirt beaux, thanks for your kind assistance at midnight! Cons: 1. The general service meets the basic requirement of the SLH standard. But it does not deliver customized and personalized service this system boasts of. 2. Most staffers are courteous and well-motivated, but some are somehow lukewarm. The Monsieur who delivered me a can of Coke at my door was a bit I'll-mannered... 3. Low staff versus customers ratio 4. Acceptance of group customers. Well... 5. Some of the finish of furnitures and interior details are a bit rough Conclusion: I will return if I could book much in advance. (A better price, I mean) Honestly, Le RC is a nice hotel, but for the 445€/night I will pay later tomorrow, mmm... It is slightly pricey. Credits to all the helpful and sweet staffers, I will return just for you.

Reviews.Title: “Serene, central and super - A gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Schmabbit
Reviews.Content: I thought I would write a review, rather belatedly on this lovely hotel. Although it is right in the centre of Paris (2 minute walk to the Seine and its islands) you feel completely relaxed and cushioned from the hustle and bustle of the city when you step into the hotels quiet courtyard on the rue Christine. My husband and I have stayed here a few times now and would not think of staying anywhere else in Paris. The staff are are all very friendly, courteous and efficient and the rooms are beautifully decorated and quite spacious considering space is at a premium in many hotels in Paris! Although there is no restaurant at the hotel there are a number of fabulous resturants within 5 minute walking distance of the hotel, however the buffet breakfast offered is copious and delicious. There is an honesty bar in the relaxing lounge area and this is a great place to sit for a nightcap before retiring for the night. We love it so much and have such happy memories we have booked to go back this October with our 2 children and their grandparents as a special surprise treat!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific service, Beautiful room, Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelto12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this wonderful hotel. Close to sights and restaurants yet set back in on a quiet rue. The service is outstanding. We did spluge for the larger room so it was a bit expensive but I would say worth it. Felt like a 5 star! We really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and super location”
Reviews.Author: AndyRandy
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel and very friendly staff, will stay now always in this Hotel... Location as well room quality is good just the rates a quite high... but if you see it you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Delightful, and Helpful...”
Reviews.Author: PutsnCalls
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of a week at Relais Christine in February 2011. Every element of our stay was superb - from the greeting to our departure. The staff is unfailingly helpful, informative, efficient, and proactive. The rooms are beautiful - a bit rustic with modern amenities and fixtures. Location of the hotel is perfect. In addition, our room was perfectly quiet. I've been a guest at several four and five star Paris hotels and Relais Christine is at the top of the list. I highly recommend you put the RC on the top of your list of considered properties.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant all the way around”
Reviews.Author: Yoshijones
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Paris and based on numerous reviews, I decided to book at Relais Christine. I would come back in a heartbeat! The rooms are very quaint, service is amazing, food is great and the location, on the Left Bank, cannot be beat. Within walking distance to Notre Dame, D'orsay, the Louvre and numerous shopping districts and restaurants. I even walked to the Catacombs, which was a bit far but very much worth it, given the amazing scenery. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Competent hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AnacoTraveler
Reviews.Content: You enter the Relais Christine from a quiet left bank street through a beautiful courtyard, a courtyard which didn't appear to have any other use. The lobby and public area of the hotel is attractive, although very compact. The hotel's location is excellent for walking to many of Paris' sites and metro stops to get to the all the others. There are lots of hotels in this area and while this is a very good hotel, there are likely many others of comparable quality and perhaps better value. Front desk personnel were personable and efficient in all dealings, with excellent recommendations and reservation service for meals. The lobby seating area features very comfortable furniture and an overpriced honor bar. ONE general use computer, with complementary internet access, is in a hallway in the lobby- more on internet later. Our room was a Junior suite on two levels-the main level featured a very nice ensuite with a very creamped living area. The upper level was up a steep, narrow stairway to a large sleeping loft and closet. On the plus side the bathroom ( including towels and toiletries) and the bed ( and linens) were very good. The cramped main floor was dark and not overly comfortable. And of course with the bathroom on the main floor and bed up, navigating a dark, narrow strairway a night was a bit harrowing. The overall decor was rather plain and dark- not nearly as rich feeling as one would expect in a 4 star house. In-room Internet had to be purchased through a third party vendor which was not user friendly and at nearly US$11 per hour not inexpensive. Why do expensive hotels charge for internet access and inexpensive hotels and B&B's offer it for free? While the room was a pleasant enough place to stay at US$530 per night it was not very good value- although our deal included one bottle of Champagne on the first day. Breakfast was about US$40 each in the attractive vaulted basement area- good quality but no variety from day to day and again not a great value. If 4 stars is important to you and money is no issue, Relais Christine will provide you a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but far from the best hotel in the SLH Paris group”
Reviews.Author: pedantictraveller Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The location was fabulous -really difficult to beat as it was walking distance from some of the best spots in Paris. However , the hotel , whilst good, was not as good as the St James Club in Paris which is part of the same group. The bedroom was small and I wasn't made to feel special in any way.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok but not amazing.”
Reviews.Author: CLW8
Reviews.Content: The hotel was charming and well decorated inside and out. The location was really great as well. PROS: Great location, charming decor inside and out. Price for what you got was fair. Staff was nice but not the best ever. Room was nice and decorated well. Room was small but that was expected. CONS: Beds are too small/short (I am only 5'7"), pillows lumpy and they had no other options, walls paper thin - could even smell someone smoking somewhere else once while I was inside my room, breakfast room dark and dreary, mildew smell in lobby/lounge area. Shower/tub had no door or curtain on it! Every time we took a shower the water was all over the bathroom floor. Very strange setup and not comfortable at all while you are in the shower. I was not so in love with this place. If they just made some small adjustments it could truly be great since the location and decor were really good. I really did not get one good night of sleep in this place and that just ruins a trip.

Reviews.Title: “A Piece of Heaven in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LeTerrible
Reviews.Content: I travel in France every two months and so I thought I'd share some more 'factual and pertinent' reviews based on seeing the best and the worst in over hundreds of hotels from the Capital to almost every region in France. 'Bien sur, je suis un homme de deux pays en ce moment, mon pays d'origine, USA ainsi que la France!' I normally stay at 'The Grand' but this time my companion pressed me into staying at this hotel that I have known for quite a while bit never experienced. Well..for this trip that had been rather hectic with crisscrossing Provence and Languedoc for work before, it was perfect. An oasis of calm in the City of lights. 4* luxe experience from the moment you enter the courtyard until you reach your room. Decorated in a serene but upscale manner to enhance the ancient building, it gives you all that you had expected from this 'first' of the boutique hotels in Paris. Our Superior room was not large but...cozy and beautifully furnished for two people. Bathroom? 5*+! The servie was impeccable and the rooms were so tranquil which is not to be taken lightly in this area on the left bank. Minutes from the hub-bub of the Latin quartier or St Germain or a nice 10 minutes walk to the beginning of the serene less hectic 7th arrondisiment, I found this to be a wonderful plus for our quick visit to see friends and relax for several days.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JDub74
Reviews.Content: We have been to Relais before, but this time we wanted to celebrate our 30th Wedding Anniversary in Paris. The conceriage service was outstanding. Wanted to make sure that we got into every restaurant we wanted. Perfect location to all the sites in Paris. Great for Americans.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: claudine88
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night in this hotel, but really liked the fact that it was extremely quiet though nestled in certainly one of the best district in Paris ( 6th). The room was not really that big compared to what we can get used to in the US for the same amount of money. But this is Paris. What you pay for here is not only the room but the super location ! A very good bed and a nice bathroom too. There is also a spa on location.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: WHEBERT
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Relais Christine for 3 nights recently and had a wonderful visit at the hotel. Though our room was small, we were perfectly comfortable and appreciated the excellent air conditioning and modern bathroom (with nice amenities). Breakfast was delicious, and the entire hotel staff was lovely. Everyone welcomed us to the hotel every time we returned from sight-seeing and were most helpful arranging dinner reservations and taxis. The hotel's proximity to all the major sites (being just 2 small blocks in from the river) made the whole city accessible and convenient. I'd recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to reputation as a SLH property”
Reviews.Author: piersti
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at other hotels in the 6th including Hotel D'Aubusson and Hotel Villa D'Estrees (both within a few blocks) on previous visits to Paris. I planned a short trip to Paris with my Mom (her first time in Paris) and wanted it to be special so decided to book 2 nights at Relais Christine as it had looked nice when I had peeked in while walking by on previous trips. I booked though the Small Luxury Hotel (SLH) website as we are SLH club members and there was a deal for a "Superior room" for about 340 euros per night that included a free bottle of wine, complimentary breakfasts, and as SLH Club members, a complimentary room upgrade if available. A week or so before the trip, I emailed the hotel and asked about a few dinner reservations as well as the status of the room upgrade. I received a response confirming the dinner reservations which was nice but the reply ignored the question regarding the room upgrade. I figured it would have to wait until check in most likely due to availability so no big deal. We arrived in Paris and checked in at the front desk. The woman was rushed and didn't mention anything about the room upgrade. I decided not to say anything since this was a treat for my Mom and didn't want her to focus on anything but having fun. We got to the room (via a dusty and dingy hallway) on the ground floor overlooking the courtyard. The room was small and rather blah with a double twin bed, tiny desk and a chair in the corner. The bathroom had clearly been updated and was very nice with a bathtub on one side by the window and a step in shower on the other side. There was no wine in the room as promised on my room reservation confirm email and no mention of our complimentary breakfasts on the welcome sheet. However, we were happy to be in Paris so we quickly grabbed our coats and headed out to explore Paris. On returning to the hotel through the entrance courtyard, we looked over and wow, you could see right into our room down to the book we left on the bed! So much for keeping our curtains open. We went back to our room and couldn't get the key to work in our door. We tried and tried and finally, with some embarrassment, went back to the front desk to ask for help. I was told that "Americans always turn the key the wrong way" (although I am now living in the UK and seem to manage to open doors). So, with my head hung low, we followed the person back to the room and lo and behold, she tried to open the door exactly the same way I did and it wouldn't work! We finally had to get a third person who with a lot of shoving and pulling got it to work and showed us the "trick". I'm all for quaint hotels but having to learn the "trick" of opening my hotel door is a bit much. Back in our room, we quickly shut the curtains and realized that there was actually no curtain in the bathroom over the tub beyond a clear vinyl sheet. We laughed as we figured you would have to crouch to get in and out of the tub if you didn't want to give someone outside a show! As it was, we grabbed our towels off the towelrack while we were still in the shower in order to not be seen through the bathroom window. The other strange thing was the location of the toilet. I think that with the room remodel, they didn't have room for the toilet in the bathroom so they relocated it to what was probably a smallish closet right by the door into the room. The toilet room was so tiny that you literally had to step inside and almost straddle the toilet to get the door shut! Again, not a huge deal but the small inconveniences were adding up when you are paying US$420 per night. The twin beds were a little soft for my taste but my Mom seemed ok with them. We enjoyed our dinner and returned to the room around 10pm. People were hanging out in the courtyard talking so we shut our window to cut down the noise. One thing I did notice was that the hotel staff did try to rush out and help people who were hauling their roller bags across the courtyard cobblestones. We all know what a racket that makes and I did appreciate them trying to carry the bags in order to keep people with rooms overlooking the courtyard from hearing constant rattling. We called room service for some ice and 30 minutes later still no ice so I called again and oops, they had forgotten so another 15 minutes for ice. This type of inconsistent and below par service continued through the second day and was just not to the level I would expect for an SLH property. In summary, Relais Christine is a nice hotel in a great location but absolutely mediocre service and average facilities for a hotel belonging to the SLH group. Also, if they are going to offer booking packages including things such as complimentary breakfasts and wine, it is not right in my opinion to make the guest have to ask again for those benefits. I had much better service and nicer rooms at the Hotel D'Aubusson (and even Villa D'Estrees which is a less espensive hotel) and would absolutely choose the D'Aubusson over Relais Christine next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Oasis on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: navygoat
Reviews.Content: Forget the double or triple-glazed windows often needed on the bustling Left Bank --- Relais Christine is a peaceful oasis. We slept with the windows open and were awakened by songbirds and cooing doves. The warm welcome, helpful staff, clean comfortable rooms and the “Honesty Bar” make this excellent hotel feel like our “home” in Paris. This was our third stay at Relais Christine, and I almost hate to let our secret out. I agree with a previous reviewer, “I am really at a loss to understand the adverse comments…” We plan to return again, and again.

Reviews.Title: “The pick of the area”
Reviews.Author: McLee58
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in Relais Christine for 5 nights. I stayed here primarily because of its location and was not disappointed. I stayed in a junior suite on the first floor. I had some serious concerns about whether I had made the right choice before I arrived given some of the adverse comments on this website although those fears were quickly put to rest. By international standards the room was not large , but it is Paris and you do not expect large rooms and it kind of adds to the ambience of the place. My room was very clean and I found the staff most helpful , especially Jeremy at the front desk who was only too willing to help us with any questions we had. I think the only other option in the area is Hotel D'Aubossen which we went and looked at , although I think noise there might be a problem.While at Relais Christine , I had a look at the garden rooms and also the standard rooms and and I think the garden rooms are expensive and not as big as the room I had.I think I would take a standard room next time as that looked quite qdequate. I did not eat breakfast in the hotel and walked about 200m to Rue de Buci which is a great street with many cafes ( especially the one next to the flower shop ) where you can really watch Paris come to life in the morning. I found the look of the restaurant in the hotel somewhat claustophobic . The three resturants in Rue Christine are all great . I did not get the opportunity to eat at the one in the street off Christine closer to the Seine ( just before the laundromat ) which looked very good. Would i stay there again - undoubtedly yes. Any criticisms? None really although in my room there was a pretty significant step from the shower /bath to the floor which could present a problem if you were elderly or unsteady on your feet. The lift was also broken for the duration of my stay which did not effect me but there were a number of complaints made , quite understandably , by other guests. The location of this hotel is exceptional, the staff were helpful and attentive, I believe it represented value for money.I am really at a loss to understand the adverse comments and cannot but help think that some people are simply never satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, questionable value”
Reviews.Author: TheBeat427
Reviews.Content: Having just completed a stay at the Relais Christine, I must say I was somewhat disappointed, especially in light of the generally glowing reviews on this site. The location is excellent, the service is good, and the staff accommodating, but the value is questionable. At the prices we paid, we could have found larger/friendlier accommodations with more amenities on the Left Bank. Yes, we would have been sacrificing ambiance; the Christine gets five stars for being atmospheric. But at the rates we paid, I expected more—that is, better performance in other areas. As a one-time visit, this was absolutely not a disaster. There is much to recommend about the hotel, and I hope I haven't given the impression that it lacks charm. At two-thirds the price, my impression would have been different.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect quiet location excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Dyffryn1941
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our ruby wedding break. The atmosphere is very quiet and peaceful. The Hotel is situated in a quiet side street very near to all left bank amenities. We had one of the garden rooms. Lovely outlook to small private garden & decking area. Room very clean and clean sheets provided each night. Service quiet & very professional. Breakfast very expensive ( 30 Euros) so we ate out just around the corner at Pauls . A nice touch was the free tray of coffee whilst we waited for the taxi back to the Gare du Nord which the hotel booked for us.. Would we stay again? ------ Certainly.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump.”
Reviews.Author: AdairUpstate
Reviews.Content: Before i start my explanation of the above title, I must provide a large disclaimer. The employees appear to work hard; certainly they try to provide prompt, cheerful and knowledgeable service. Without question. However, there do not appear to be enough employees to cover the needs of guests at this not-inexpensive hotel. This is the third time I have stayed in Relais Christine. Each time, I've read Tripadvisor reviews as i planned a trip, and thought that maybe I'd e been mistaken in not enjoying my stays at Relais Christine. But no! Three bad times here, and I feel I must bring up the shortcomings of this apparently popular Paris hotel. Two of the three rooms in which we've stayed have been dark, dirty, and dingy. The third was lighter and relatively cleaner, though not what we'd call comfortable. There is dust on much of the furniture (which is quite nicked up , and not becaus it's antique!). The hot water is often only tepid, the bedding is of the cheap variety - mushy, and sometimes unlevel. The breakfast room, while picturesque, is often too crowded for the number of rooms being covered. Location is a big reason to choose this part of the 6th Arrondisemnet, but certianly there must be better properties!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: 1D3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for at least one night during each of my trips to France for the past 5 years. I have never been disappointed. They pay a great deal of attention to even the smallest details. For example, every day there is a small card in the room giving the weather forecast. They have a CD player and CD's of French music (classical, jazz, etc.) in each room. It is absolutely the most relaxing hotel I have ever visited anywhere. I have stayed in many different rooms in this hotel and each one is charming in its own unique way. Every time I go there I feel that I am being welcomed into someone's home. Of course, my friends don't usually present me with a bill at the end of my stay, but I think it is well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: pelun
Reviews.Content: Stayed 18-22 February in Duplex room #50. What an amazing and romantic hotel! A very old building which has been gently renovated, maintaining the old charm but also modernized giving all the comfort! A wonderful entrance through a beautiful courtyard into a lovely reception area. We were warmly welcomed by the excellent staff. We had booked a Deluxe room with SLH but where upgraded to a Duplex on the third (top) floor. The room was recently refurbished (which I had requested after given such recommendation in other reviews) and it was top of the line! Downstairs a sofa (bed sofa), table, flat screen TV, bar and stereo. Several windows giving nice and light view. A smaller dressing room with plenty of clothing space. Next the modern and beautiful bathroom having 2 washbasins, bathtub and a separate shower with a rain shower. Great! Upstairs was the bedroom with small working desk, a built-in bookcase and another flat screen tv. Good size, very comfortable and lovely decorated. Since this the top floor, attic, the ceilings bended slightly and it was fitted with a skylight window. The whole Duplex was very comfortable, nice size and really cozy. Modern but yet with an older touch and charm. For instance, all lightening can be dimmed and skylight window has an electric curtain. The hotel doesn’t have a restaurant (although 24 hours room service) but there are many excellent places to eat just outside the hotel. They have an “honesty” bar which is very charming and you get the feeling of being at home in your own living room. There is a breakfast room, a spa and a fitness room in the basement, none of which we managed to see, but no doubts in the same charming spirit as the rest of the hotel. One downside point: although accessible wireless internet in the room, it is not free of charge (must be changed!!!). Hotel offer free wireless in the “honesty” bar and use of stationary computer in separate room. As mentioned before, the staff is friendly, services minded and efficient. I have stayed several times at the Pavillion de la Reine on Place des Vosges which is one of my favorite places in Paris, both the hotel and the location. Relais Christine is now definitely another of my preferred hotels in Paris with a similar charm in the attractive St Germain area. Don’t hesitate to go there! We shall return!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: josiebrussels
Reviews.Content: i went to paris with 6 friends to celebrate a 40th birthday--from the start we were charmed by the beautiful hotel. the location is perfect, nestled in the vibrant st germaine area surrounded by small shops and excellent restaurants. the rooms were small but clean and nicely appointed--we stayed in duplexes with separate sitting quarters that were convenient for drinking the complimentary bottle of champagne the hotel had provided for my friend's birthday. we enjoyed the "honesty bar" downstairs where we sat in a comfortable living room by a fire and had more champagne. after all the champagne, i managed to leave my phone in a restaurant, which was closed the next day. after i left paris, the concierge at the hotel found my phone, sent it to me, and endured a number of desperate phone-calls and emails. he was never less than professional and polite and extremely helpful. i would absolutely stay here again; next time i will bring my husband and children and hang on tightly to my phone!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debbyghouston
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Relais Christine again! It had been several years since our last stay and the hotel has only gotten better. Every staff member we encountered was highly professional. The location is superb and quiet. If traveling to Paris in the future, we would definitely stay at the Relais Christine again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Guileen
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at Relais Christine, it's a small hotel so it has the intimacy and service that larger establishments lack. Great central location, we walked everywhere. Staff friendly and accommodating. We had a room at garden level which was lovely, would be fabulous in Spring and Summer. Very quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Depressed in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Paul F
Reviews.Content: We've been Relais Christine before and loved it (2008) So we came back and were VERY disappointed. For €370,00 = $550 we were put in a very small, very stuffy, very dark and very purple room on the 3rd floor, just under the roof. Since I have been travelling the world I always check for emergency exits and was not happy at all with what I found .. it's quite a jump from the third floor down. When we fired off the airco we had a choice: either the noise or the heat since the airco apparently had not been used since opening day and tried hard (a bit too hard for our taste) to do its work - so open the windows. Not a good idea since garbage collection in Paris is at 5am so a short night. To get wide awake I took the shower which resulted in a very wet wooden bathroom floor where we spotted some until now unknown fungus that apparently did love the wooden floor. My wife took the bath.. We got use to wash one by one one since there was no place fot two in the bathroom but the toilet was ok. All in all I do not think we'll be back..

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel all-around”
Reviews.Author: WhhCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Great experience recently. They have a marvelous spa in the lower level - exercise room, hot tub with nearby showers, etc. Breakfast quite good although there may be a short wait for staff to clear tables. Honor bar in their Library Room was enjoyable. Free wi-fi in the lobby and the Library Room generally worked well. Great beds! Marvelous location, and they were very helpful in making all our restaurant reservations. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: eb500
Reviews.Content: We thought the location of this hotel was fantastic. While the hotel itself seemed a bit old, the room was clean, quiet, and relatively spacious for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting and a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Laura525
Reviews.Content: We arrived in France at 10:30 in the morning, never expecting the congenial staff at the Relais Christine to rush to get our room ready. Throughout three wonderful nights and nearly four days, we experienced the same lovely dedication to service, from the helpful concierge to housekeeping. The hotel is quietly beautiful, with a vaulted 13th-century basement that is now the gorgeous fitness center with exquisite whirlpool/jacuzzi. Just don't get a manicure - the cost is 100 euros! Our Deluxe room was unique and very special. This former convent is perfectly located about 1 block from the Seine in the Left Bank. There are so many special restaurants located nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Comfort in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PNWsunseeker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Relais Christine for a couple nights during our travels through Europe to celebrate our 20th anniversary. We were here the night of our anniversary, and the staff sent up a bottle of champagne to help us celebrate, which was surprising and delightful. They also cheerfully canceled a dinner reservation they had made for us when I wasn't feeling well and decided to eat nearby (we wound up walking over to the Rue de Buci for "take out", which was perfect). This was my 4th trip to Paris, and Relais Christine is my favorite hotel experience so far in this city - excellent location, quiet, clean, modern amenities yet charming decor, and friendly staff. And I'm still having fun telling my friends about the $40 USD continental breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful and charming Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gigi019
Reviews.Content: A delightful hotel with lots of ambience and charm especially loved the bar set up of an honesty system very polished. The staff are very obliging and friendly especially the lovely lady in the breakfast area greeting us each morning with a welcoming and friendly smile and not to forget the lovely gentleman who assisted with our luggage no matter how heavy it was. Rooms are charming with every comfort you could not want for more being so far from home. Thanks to the staff at Relais Christine for making our stay so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Romantic Gem”
Reviews.Author: elyfretz
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel ! Love the lounge area and honest bar. It feels like my living room... Fantastic touch and attention to detail. Much better than the so called 5 star deluxe hotel that we stayed at a few days prior in Rome. I would come back here in a heart beat. Very posh and quaint.

Reviews.Title: “excellent luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: manhattantwo
Reviews.Content: It had been my wife's dream to stay at the Relais Christine, and this summer we finally did it. It was my eighth trip to Paris and I had never stayed in a luxury hotel before. Pluses: I cannot imagine a better location, unless you are going to Paris for a very long stay. A block from the river (for sightseeing), Rue de Buci and Blvd St Germain (for eating and shopping) yet quiet--I mean pin-drop, like a tomb, quiet! I have never had a room in Paris which was so isolated from street noise. Room was tastefully outfitted, unlike some Paris rooms which seem to decorated within an inch of their lives; it had a lovely small balcony overlooking the courtyard, on the first floor. For our anniversary, the staff gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne. When we needed anything, like ice or directions, the hotel staff was obliging and speedy. The bathroom was excellent, with a long tub (I am tall, so I appreciated this.) Cons: the superior room was not huge for the money (300 E), although roomy enough for two chairs and desk. (I gather the classic rooms are smaller, and would not recommend them if that is true.) And we did not take the breakfast: 30E ($40) pp is a ridiculous price to pay when there are great cafes, boulangeries and patisseries literally around the corner on Rue de Buci (Carton is legendary), where you can get the best pastry of your life, or on St Andre des Arts where you can get juice, snacks, pizza, etc. You are paying only for convenience and fancy china. All things considered, though, the hotel was an outstanding Paris experience and we would definitely repeat it, for a short stay. Location, location!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely romantic hotel in the heart of old Paris”
Reviews.Author: tamartravel
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week at the Relais Christine this July. A picturesque, charming and quiet place in the heart of a very old but hopping part of Paris. The staff makes a great team and we felt that they did everything to make our first visit in Paris, France aan unforgetable experience. We know that space in this area is scarce and dear, and they do their best to make use of every centimeter. It helped that they stored away our luggage and that were happy to continue to store it for the time we left Paris. Things that could use improvement were— 1. the lighting in the rooms (they are way too dark) 2. the electric power (we never had enough plugs to charge our phones, cameras etc. and the fuses were not working well) 3. although the bathroom was magnificent and immaculate, the bathtub was uncomfortably small. The shower curtain sticks to the guest’s body because the tub is very narrow, and the tub is hard to get into and very slippery which can cause an accident 4. most importantly, the air-conditioning never did cool down the room to a comfortable level. However, we want to reiterate that the staff is first-rate-- the sweetest and nicest, most helpful crew. They were friendly and accommodating, always ready to lend a hand. We will definitely come back one day.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of Parisian romance...”
Reviews.Author: AlexCLondon1
Reviews.Content: My partner (now fiance) stayed here on our very first mini-break from London so expecations for the romance factor were high! We found the staff very nice but unobtrusive, the room (junior suite) was stylish and well fitted out although a little dark, and bathroom spotless. Breakfast in the vaulted dining room was lovely and the spa facilities were really memorable too in terms of the setting in the cloisters of the building. Would definitely recommend and an excellent location to walk to all the key areas in Paris. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Elegance”
Reviews.Author: NickBB
Reviews.Content: A chariming boutique hotel far from the madding crowd. We enjoyed the relaxed informality of the Christine althoug found the overall comfort rather sparse for the money (especially the old blankets and overly soft pillows). The staff are friendly and courteous, always ready to please. We stayed in the duplex for five nights which was spacious and practical for my wife and I and the two kids but certainly a functional experience versus a luxury one. the breakfast experience is a startling one to say the least , as one descends into the bowels of the hotel into a hot, airless chamber.......this was a one-off event and then we went out to the many sunny, open-air cafes for a much cheaper and more fun start to the day. All in all, good but not great.
